dcterms:description: The linear advection equation is a fundamental PDE that describes the propagation of waves and is characterized by solutions that translate initial conditions at a constant speed.
dcterms:title: Linear Advection Equation

dcterms:description: The inviscid Burgers' equation is a nonlinear PDE that models wave-breaking and shockwave formation from smooth initial conditions, characterized by the development of discontinuities over time.
dcterms:title: Inviscid Burgers' Equation

dcterms:description: The Kuramoto-Sivashinsky equation is a nonlinear PDE used as a model for chaotic dynamics and turbulent flame fronts, exhibiting complex spatiotemporal behavior.
dcterms:title: Kuramoto-Sivashinsky Equation
